summary: Flickering icon in URL location field
description:
The link rel="icon" feature is a very nice generalisation of favico, but the
resulting graphic has a tendency to flicker when moving between pages, even when
those pages are referencing the exact same graphic in the exact same location,
so that the graphic remains, overall, unchanged.

navigating around www.mozilla.org illustrates this well. There would ideally be
no flicker.

Suggest that, (only if link is followed to new page on same server?), the
decision to redraw the graphic (and update the URL?) only be made once the head
of the new page has been read to find out whether the same graphic, or no
graphic, is referenced. (Not sure introducing hysteresis on updating the URL is
necessarily a good thing, since you then can't e.g. see redirects in action and
learn urls to hand-edit.)

I've no idea what should happen if e.g. image type is unspecified/differs and
content negotiation comes into play.
